translation: From food come forth beings; from rain, food is produced; from sacrifice arises rain, and sacrifice is born of action.
commentary: 3.14 Annat from food? are they come forth? Bhootani beings? parjanyaat from rain? Annasambhavah production of food? Yajnat from sacrifice? becomes arises? Parjanya: rain? Yajna: sacrifice? karmasamudbhavah born of action.Commentary Here Yajna means Apurva or the subtle principle or the unseen form which a sacrifice assumes between the time of its performance and the time when its fruits manifest themselves.
